alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 09 at 2:38PM PST until December 10 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Isolated accumulations up to 9 inches possible above 2500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Oregon, Western Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Most snowfall will occur east of Bonneville, but may see a mixed precipitation of snow and rain as far west as Corbett. Could see isolated higher amounts up to 9 inches, but with the wet nature of the snow, accumulations to that amount will be difficult.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
